    Options for a 3PL customer in the partner portal

    Options for a 3PL customer in the partner portal

    First, you must give your partner access by sending them an email with an invitation link then your partner needs to accept the invitation through the link in their inbox or junk box and start the process of creating an account.

    After accepting the invitation and registering to the partner portal you have an insight into all partners and which of them accepted the invitation or are still not accepted.

    There are three different types of Partners:

    we distinguish each partner from other partners in which they get access to specific parts of the warehouse Administration.

    Here are the options for a 3PL Customer:

    a 3PL customer can see information about company details like,

    **Partners menu:**addresses, in here you see all addresses of 3PL partners, and you can also add a new address for a new partner. for more information click here.

    Partners menu: Item, in here you see all items available for 3PL partners and you can add new 3PL items.

    for more information click here.

    Document menu Shipments: you see all shipments and create new shipments.

    for more information click here.

    Document menu Deliveries: you see all deliveries and create new deliveries.

    for more information click here.

    **Exchange profiles:**here you can digitally exchange files for more information see automatically exchange files tutorial.

    Stock: Stock items are products or goods that are held in inventory for sale or distribution.

    These items are typically stored in warehouses or storage facilities until they are needed for orders or shipments.

    Items: Managing stock items involves tracking quantities, organizing storage locations, and optimizing inventory levels to meet demand while minimizing carrying costs.

    License plates: is unique identifiers assigned to individual items or pallets within a warehouse.

    These identifiers help in tracking and locating specific stock items within the facility.

    They can be used in conjunction with barcode scanning or RFID technology to streamline inventory management and improve accuracy in picking and packing processes.

    Locations: are physical areas within a warehouse or distribution center where stock items are stored.

    Efficient organization of locations is essential for maximizing storage space utilization and facilitating smooth inbound and outbound operations.

    We use cookies to try and give you a better experience in Supplychain365.

Just note that the Freshdesk service is pretty big on some cookies (we love the choco-chip ones), and some portions of Freshdesk may not work properly if you disable cookies.
